list_definition.definition: a raised platform especially for performing or acting on, eg in a theatre/theater

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The actors had already assembled on the stage ready for the curtain to go up.

list_definition.definition: to prepare and produce (a play etc) in a theatre/theater etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This play was first staged in 1928.
The protesters are planning to stage a demonstration.

list_definition.definition: a period or step in the development of something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The plan is in its early stages
At this stage, we don’t know how many survivors there are.
The first stage of our journey will be the flight to Singapore.

list_definition.definition: a section of a bus route.

list_ex_of_english: The period affects all young people and involves a series of stages over a number of years, which are influenced by social and economic status.
The procedure of the proposed system design contains input data preparation and neural network training stages.
In the current early stages of multi-agent design these two approaches are being developed simultaneously.
Two stages of this homogenization process are under consideration.
A portion of these phenomena can undoubtedly be accounted for in terms of the temporal response of the first stages of the visual system.
On the other hand, as encephalographic registrations of sleep stages were not made in this study, such a conclusion can only be tentative.
I would recommend allowing one laboratory per open reading frame in the initial stages.
Men here, in various stages of undress, were pulling on outer clothing and armour.
